elements.title: West Street Foundry (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Brooklyn's West Street Foundry, owned by Wilson Small, built the engine for Daniel Webster (pictured), which on debut in 1853 was the largest and fastest steamboat in Maine coastal service?

elements.title: Thiri Zeya Thura (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after a successful siege of Mogaung, Commander Thiri Zeya Thura rushed back to Ava, arriving there in time for the coronation of Narapati I to present the captured sawbwa?

elements.title: flag of Montserrat (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the flag of Montserrat depicts Erin embracing a cross, signifying the Montserratians' love of Christ?

elements.title: Dijon Talton (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that years after he played a recurring character on Glee during its first season, Dijon Talton reprised his role as Matt Rutherford in the final two episodes?

elements.title: Ich lobe meinen Gott von ganzem Herzen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "Ich lobe meinen Gott von ganzem Herzen" is a cheerful hymn based on the beginning of Psalm 9?

elements.title: Indiana HB 1041 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Indiana HB 1041, a law that bans transgender girls from participating in school sports, was vetoed and overridden in three days?

elements.title: W. W. Covey-Crump (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the son of Reverend Canon W. W. Covey-Crump, Commander A. T. L. Covey-Crump, compiled a list of Jack-speak that is still consulted by historians of the Royal Navy?

elements.title: Pulsallama (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that no wave band Pulsallama was described as "13 girls fighting over a cowbell"?
